page.title: 02Mixed Farming, N.Alcester
page.content: Among the 10 farms in this area there is considerable variety, so that farming can truly be regarded as 'mixed'. On the farms among the Alne Hills crop cultivation is the most important activity, with winter wheat and barley predominating. Here animals are kept only in small numbers, although Dingle Farm has a flock of 120 sheep and 100 poultry. Further south and west land is lower and nearer to the rivers Alne and Arrow. The presence of heavy clay has necessitated drainage work. Here the land is more suitable for cattle rearing. Two farms of several hundred acres have beef and dairy herds. Grass and barley are grown for fodder and there is a substantial amount of pasture. One other farm is entirely dairy and another has cows and sheep.
